material module¶

class material.AblativeMaterial(args)¶

Bases: material.Material

stores ablative material properties

calculateAblativeProperties(args)¶

calculate pyrolysis gas composition and bprime table

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of arguments

calculateBPrimes(args)¶

calculates bprime tables using bprime executable provided by mutation++

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of arguments

calculateEnergies()¶

shifts virgin and char internal energies so that heat of formations are correct with respect to those calculated by Mutation++

calculateHatmo(args)¶

calculates atmospheric enthalpy

Parameters

args (dict) – input arguments

calculatePyroGasComposition(args)¶

calculates pyrolysis gas composition using mppequil

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of arguments

calculateVariables()¶

creates splines for each material property (cp, k, eps, …), virgin and char

plotBc()¶

plots Bc over T table with Bg as parameter

plot_hw()¶

plots wall enthalpy hw over T with Bg as parameter

readBPrimes(args)¶

reads bprime table from csv file

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of input arguments

readFile(iDir, globdir, csv_files)¶

reads csv file and stores data

Parameters

  • iDir (int) – directory number

  • globdir (str) – global path to directory

  • csv_files (list) – csv files in directory

readPyroGasComposition(args)¶

reads pyrolysis gas enthalpy from csv file (first column T, second column hgas)

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of input arguments

storeVariables(args)¶

stores pressure and atmosphere values

Parameters

args (dict) – dictionary of arguments

class material.CorrugatedMaterial(args)¶

Bases: material.Material

save material properties for corrugated sandwich cores; For the used formulas, see eqs. 1-3 in: Gogu, C., Bapanapalli, S. K., Haftka, R. T., & Sankar,B. V. (2009). Comparison of materials for an integrated thermal protection system for spacecraft reentry. Journal of Spacecraft and Rockets, 46(3), 501–513. https://doi.org/10.2514/1.35669

material.constructLinearSpline(x, y)¶

constructs a piecewise linear spline through data

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray) – x data as array (variable)

  • y (np.ndarray) – y data as array (dependent)

Returns

type – spline that is equal at nodes, and linear in-between

Return type

ip.UnivariateSpline

material.convertf(st)¶
material.createMaterial(inputdir, outfile=None, ablative=True, corrugated=False, Trange='300:100:6000', pressure=101325, bg='0.01:0.3333:100', atmosphere='Earth', corrugated_vals=None, bprime=None, hgas=None)¶

creates a Material class object that holds various thermophysical properties

Parameters

  • corrugated_vals – saves information about corrugated layer properties (Default value = None)

  • inputdir – input directory

  • outfile – output file (Default value = None)

  • ablative – ablative material flag (Default value = True)

  • Trange – range of temperature for bprime calculation in K (format: min:step:max) (Default value = “300:100:6000”)

  • pressure – pressure for bprime calculation in Pa (Default value = 101325)

  • bg – range of non-dimensional gas-blowing rate (format: min:orderOfMagnitudePerStep:max) (Default value = “0.01:0.3333:100”)

  • atmosphere – string that specifies the atmosphere (Default value = “Earth”)

  • corrugated – (Default value = False)

  • bprime – (Default value = None)

  • hgas – (Default value = None)

Returns

mat – Material instance

Return type

material.Material

material.dropnafromboth(x)¶

Parameters

x (pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) – cleared DataFrame

Returns

x – cleared DataFrame

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame
